plot: John Oliver discusses a surprising letter from Kim Jong-un to President Trump, journalist Arkady Babchenko's rising from the grave, a British royal expert born an Italian American, and the fraught issue of senior citizen guardianship.

Guardianship is a good way to support the elderly people who cannot take responsible decision about their life and estates. But for the lack of specific regulations and constructive monitoring, guardians has the opportunity to take unfair advantages from the ward's estates. Because under guardianship wards have very limited rights while the guardians have huge access over ward's financial and health issues. So various elderly celebrity recorded a warning message so that everyone select a responsible person who will look after one's personal affairs when he/she grows old.—Niaz Islam Arif
